conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 4000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count> 1 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 4000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Since the production cost for my resource X was 4000 ZUP, I would like to make a profit from that investment. I will start with a higher asking price to leave room for negotiation. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 5000 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I'm offering resource X which has cost me 4000 ZUP to produce. Considering its value, I propose a trade for 5000 ZUP. This price includes the production cost and a reasonable profit margin. Let's negotiate if this starting point doesn't work for you. </message>

<other player message> I understand your costs and the need for profit, but I would like to counter with an offer of 4500 ZUP. This is above your stated production cost, ensuring you make a profit, while also being within a more comfortable spending range for me. Let's find a fair middle ground. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 4500 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 2 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 4000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> The counteroffer from Player BLUE is reasonable as it is above my production cost. However, I believe the resource's value justifies a higher price. To continue negotiations and come to a mutual agreement, I will lower my asking price but not as much as Player BLUE has proposed. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 4750 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your offer. I'm glad to see your willingness to ensure I make a profit. As a compromise, I propose a price of 4750 ZUP. This gives us both a fair deal, considering the production costs and the value of the resource. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your flexibility and the compromise. I'm willing to move up to 4650 ZUP. This should cover your production costs and provide a reasonable profit while still being within my budget. What do you think? </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 4650 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 3 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 4000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE's latest proposal is a fair middle ground, moving closer to my last asking price. It still ensures a profit for me but also respects the buyer's budget constraints. I will accept this offer, as it seems like a balanced agreement that meets the interests of both parties. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Your offer of 4650 ZUP is acceptable to me. It provides a good balance between my production costs and the need for profit, and it also respects your budget. I'm happy to proceed with this trade. Thank you for the constructive negotiation. </message>
